definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
the solar year/the year defined as the period between successive equinoxes
tropic/one of the two latitude lines, Tropic of Capricorn or Tropic of Cancer

sentences.english: Believing the batterers and hoping for real change, some women return to these abusive relationships.
sentences.chinese: 一些女人心存希望他們能真正改變而回歸。

sentences.english: In some cases, women return to abusive relationships because they feel sorry for their abusers.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情況下，女人因歉疚而回歸受虐家庭。

sentences.english: Bonera returned, but at the same time I must evaluate the conditions of Antonini.
sentences.chinese: 博內拉回歸，但同時我又要評估安東尼尼的狀態。

sentences.english: The quality of the noise removal was improved by combining wavelet packet transform with latent variable regression (LVR).
sentences.chinese: 該法結合小波包變換和潛變量回歸改進除噪質量。

sentences.english: Describes a formulation composed of wheat straw for growing RussulalePida compiled with orthogonal regression design.
sentences.chinese: 採用正交回歸設計研究了紅菇栽培配方。

sentences.english: China's awe-inspiring rise is often framed as the return to a historical norm.
sentences.chinese: 中國威風凜凜的崛起經常標上回歸歷史正常水平。

sentences.english: Appling the method of mathematical regression analysis, one multivariate regression equation are given out.
sentences.chinese: 用數學回歸的方法推導出了一個多元迴歸方程。

sentences.english: Appling the method of mathematical regression analysis, one regression equation are given out.
sentences.chinese: 用數學回歸的方法推導出了一個迴歸方程。

sentences.english: The emphasis in juvenile courts is upon rehabilitation of youthful offenders rather than punishment.
sentences.chinese: 少年法庭的重心是使青少年違者回歸社會而非懲罰。

definition: to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
